Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior, which has flaked away in parts, is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394582) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394582)
